description: Our favorite go to bar in Hayes. Delicious drinks, good service, not too douchy of a crowd. And a plus, open window for great people watching...so if you are sitting there and see a couple stalking your spot it's probably us!
author: Adina L.

description: I got a summer ale here with a friend. I liked the atmosphere and the weather was a lovely 70 degrees and they had the big window at the front open, which created that kind of half inside, half outside feel. Lots of beers on tap and it looked like they were churning out some fancy cocktails.
author: Madeline S.

description: This place use to be a Gay bar; now it is full of breeders..ugh...
author: Joe N.

description:
love this place. 
great drinks. i was little shy about the conversation cocktail because of the root beer syrup but it was perfectly balanced, just sweet enough.
plus, metallica playing in the background. 
i'm sold.
author: tinkerbell e.

description: Cool place, good music crowd is very diverse. Bartenders are on it!!! Their Moscow mule is really good. Cocktail list is top notch. Check it out I recommend it
author: Waldo A.

description: really solid drinks and a great environment.
author: Joel B.

description: Interesting cocktails and nice service, dark ambiance and decent prices. A good place to count on for drinks if you're in the area, but you probably won't find a place to sit.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Nice remodel, good vibe. However, drinks were mediocre I thought... tried 3 different drinks, all a bit overkill. I'd come back here for location and the space, but will stick to beer.
author: Val J.

description:
Like how my little brother says it in a text, "KEWL"

This place is "kewl". Definitely brought in a different type of crowd since they re-opened and change the name of the business. Very trendy, chic and offers wide variety of alcohol. It is nice addition to the area. 

Plus good looking people here too! Plus plus
author: J C.

description: This is my spot during the work week. Great selection of drinks, always good music and some of my favorite people in town behind the bar and at the door.
author: Alec N.

description: Great neighborhood bar here in hayes valley. Since i live in the neighborhood its refreshing to have an awesome cocktail bar open up with bartenders who are super knowledgeable and know what they're talking about. Id give the place 5 stars but on weekends its such a mad house becomes so cramped inside that its just hard to enjoy yourself. I'd recommend coming in before 6 on weekends or if you can any time during the week.
author: Zino M.

description: Great chill bar in Hayes Valley...lots of good choices to choose from. The beer selection was a hit. Anywhere that has Stone IPA on tap is a bonus for me. The bartenders were super nice as well. All around this is a great spot to drop in for a drink!
author: Ladybird G.

description: Big window street side. Spartan set of quality alcohols behind the bar. Not your usual tap choices - selection includes Stillwater, a favorite brewery of mine. Nice beats. Hayes Valley keeps getting better.
author: Craig L.

description: Arrive early for a seat in the window!  Especially now that the weather is lovely and the place has become popular.
author: Ring Leader D.

description: Stopped by here for drinks on a late Sunday afternoon. Chill place, well-mixed drinks, nice staff.
author: Rowena L.

description: Not really good for a date as the acoustics are not good. However, the unique cocktails are worth it and can make a boring date more interesting.
author: Keren R.

description:
The cocktails are great, no doubt. But, as with many "premium" cocktail joints across the City (see, e.g., Rickhouse, Bloodhound), the atmosphere sucks so hard that I'd almost pay money NOT to hang out here. Guys, the room is a long shoe-box with nothing on the walls to dampen the sound. Do you REALLY need the music to be that loud? Can't you see EVERYBODY in the place straining to hear one another?

I like cocktails. But I like talking to my friends even better. I live a block away from this place and pretty much never want to go back.
author: J M.

description: I probably need to go back to try the cocktails, but there a decent selection of unique beers available here ranging from $3 standard beers to $10 beers that are a bit more interesting.
author: Nik K.

description: Terrible service. This could be a really great spot - good ambience, etc. But the patrons and servers really don't live up to what they should be. As a local, I recommend against coming here.
author: Jessie J.

description: Had brunch around the corner and stopped into this place.  Their cocktails were strong but also had a good beer selection for my friends who wanted a good IPA.  The place is super chill, allows dogs, and has a good vibe to it (at least during the day when I went).  Definitely a cool spot to stop in for a few drinks.
author: Eric M.

description: All was fine (good drinks - good service - good atmosphere) until one of the bartenders decided that the place was too crowded and took my seat away. Literally. She picked it up - declared the location a fire hazard - and walked off with it. We were five drinking adults (with four seats) in an overcrowded bar (see all other reviews - they all remind you that the place is crowded) with two credit cards at the bar. No apologies as I asked for it back - no effort to make it up to us. Just a cold hard stare as she walked away.... Last time I go back until/unless they track me down and apologize. I'll let you know.
author: Alex B.

description: One has to have a lot of style and personality to open a bar that can become a local favorite--Marlena had that. This place just seems like every other place that is opening up. Reclaimed wood; utilitarian, post-industrial stripped down; precisely measured shots in a lab glass (just give it a healthy pour!). The music was good, but incredibly loud, so after awhile we moved venues--it was just too piercing. You have to scream to hear each other. The crowd was very homogeneous, but no wonder given the ubiquity of the design. This place needs to find an identity and integrate itself into the community if I'm going to come back. There's no trace of Marlena or the old place anywhere, which is sad and disrespectful. San Francisco is painting over itself. The service was very good though and the drinks fairly priced.
author: Jerry P.

description: Great ambience, fun crowd, not too loud, and I had an einstok beer for the first time - yummy.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Delicious finely crafted cocktails. Very friendly service in a great location. Small, charming bar.
author: Daniel R.

description: The bar and drinks are great. Generally a good, friendly crowd keeps this place buzzing. Lots of good food options nearby, though they don't serve any bar snacks themselves.
author: Vivek s.
